script.text: 对话一：考试以后 (After a Test)
script.en: Dialogue 1: After a test.
Test results are in. 矮中 —
What'd I get?
Sixty-two.
No way.
You wrote 矮 instead of 爱.
...What?

script.zh: 他的考试上，每个"爱"字都写成了"矮"。"我矮中国文化"。"我矮吃中国菜"。
script.en: On his test, every 爱 was written as 矮. "I short Chinese culture." "I short eating Chinese food."

script.zh: 等一下。你不知道爱和矮的区别？
script.en: Hold on. You don't know the difference between 爱 and 矮?
They look the same!

script.zh: 它们完全不一样。爱下面是友，矮下面是矢。一个是love，一个是short。
script.en: They're completely different. 爱 has 友 on the bottom, 矮 has 矢. One is love, the other is short.

script.zh: 对了。我有一个事要跟你们说。
script.en: Oh right. I have something to tell you guys.

script.zh: 上周六晚上在酒吧那边纹的。纹身师说他经常纹中文。
script.en: Got it Saturday night at a place near the bar. The tattoo artist said he does Chinese characters all the time.
...What character is that?
爱! Love! Because I love China!

script.text: 王崩凑过来看。表情变了。
script.en: 王崩 leans in to look. His expression changes.
...That's not 爱.
What?
That character is 矮.
What's 矮?

script.zh: 矮。Short。你纹了"短"在你胳膊上。
script.en: 矮. Short. You tattooed "short" on your arm.
Holy sh*t. He's right.

script.text: 卧槽 first appearance in the book.
script.en: First appearance of 卧槽 in the book.
No way. The tattoo artist —

script.zh: 这是我这辈子见过最好笑的事。
script.en: This is the funniest thing I've ever seen in my life.
Don't take photos —
Too late. Already sent it to the group chat.

script.zh: ……确实是矮。但是爱和矮看起来有一点像。你不知道的话很容易搞混。
script.en: ...It is 矮. But 爱 and 矮 do look a little alike. Easy to mix up if you don't know.

script.zh: "容易搞混"？？我永久地纹了"矮"在我身上！
script.en: "Easy to mix up"?? I permanently tattooed 矮 on my body!
At least it's accurate. You are short.

script.zh: ……你知道吗。无所谓。这是conversation starter。女孩子会问。我就讲这个故事。Content。
script.en: ...You know what. Whatever. It's a conversation starter. Girls will ask about it. I'll tell the story. Content.
...That is kinda sigma actually.
...It actually kind of suits him.
What did you say?
Nothing.

script.text: 对话二：男生群聊 (Boys' Chat — That Night)
script.en: Dialogue 2: Boys' Chat -- That Night.

script.zh: 你能不能教我怎么分辨这两个字？
script.en: Can you teach me how to tell these two characters apart?
爱 — love. 友 (friend) on the bottom. 矮 — short. 矢 (arrow) on the bottom.
友 and 矢 also look really similar...
You need more practice.

script.zh: 我在练！我每天出去跟人聊天不就是练吗？
script.en: I am practicing! Going out and chatting with people every day, isn't that practice?

script.zh: 那是practice speaking。不是practice writing。你能说很多但你写不出来。
script.en: That's practice speaking. Not practice writing. You can say a lot but you can't write any of it.
Speaking is more important than writing.

script.zh: 看你要做什么。如果你要在中国泡吧，说就够了。如果你想真的学中文——得读、得写。
script.en: Depends on what you want to do. If you want to hit bars in China, speaking is enough. If you want to actually learn Chinese — you gotta read and write.
...You're right. But reading and writing are so boring.
Welcome to learning Chinese.

grammarNotes.title: 会/能/可以
grammarNotes.body:
- 会：learned ability. 我会说中文 (I can speak Chinese)
- 能：physical or circumstantial ability. 我今天不能来 (I can't come today)
- 可以：permission. 我可以坐这儿吗？(May I sit here?)

grammarNotes.title: 认识 vs 知道
grammarNotes.body:
- 认识 = to know (a person, a character). 我认识这个字 (I recognize this character)
- 知道 = to know (a fact). 我不知道这个词 (I don't know this word)

grammarNotes.title: V得/V不 + complement
grammarNotes.body:
看得懂 = can understand (reading)
看不懂 = can't understand
听得懂 / 听不懂 = can / can't understand (listening)
分得清 / 分不清 = can / can't tell apart
Pattern: Verb + 得 (able) or 不 (unable) + result. 王崩说：我看不懂简体字。
